member.name: T:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.FieldDictionary
member.summary: An alias for to ensure the proper equality of keys to objects.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.FieldDictionary.keyComparer
member.summary: An instance of specialized to byte arrays.

member.name: P:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.FieldDictionary.KeyComparer
member.summary: Provide access to a comparer specialized for field keys.

member.name: M:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.FieldDictionary.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that is empty and has the default initial capacity.
member.remarks:
Every key in a must have a unique sequence of values.
If you can estimate the size of the collection, using eliminates the need to perform a number of resizing operations while adding elements.
This constructor is an O(1) operation.

member.name: M:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.FieldDictionary.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that is empty and has the specified initial capacity.
member.remarks:
Every key in a must have a unique sequence of values.
The capacity of a is the number of elements that can be added to the before resizing is necessary. As elements are added to a , the capacity is automatically increased as required by reallocating the internal array. Therefore, if the largest size of the collection can be estimated, specifying an initial capacity of that size or greater eliminates the need to perform a number of resizing operations while adding elements to the .
This constructor is an O(1) operation.
member.param: The initial number of elements that the can contain.

member.name: M:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.FieldDictionary.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.Byte[],System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{AgEitilt.CardCatalog.TagField}})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of a that contains elements copied from .
member.remarks:
Every key in a must have a unique sequence of values; every key in must therefore also have a unique sequence of values.
IThe initial capacity of the new is large enough to contain all the elements in .
This constructor is an O(n) operation, where n is the number of elements in .
member.param: The whose elements are copied to the new .

member.name: T:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.ScanAssemblyAttribute
member.summary:
Indicate that the assembly should be scanned for classes marked with to automatically register.
This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: T:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.MetadataFormatAttribute
member.summary:
Indicate that the class implements a metadata format specification.
This class cannot be inherited.
member.remarks: The class must implement .

member.name: P:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.MetadataFormatAttribute.Name
member.summary: The unique short name representing this format.

member.name: M:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.MetadataFormatAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified .
member.param:
The unique short name representing this format.
It is recommended that this also be exposed as a constant on the type itself.

members.member:
Marks a method as being a validation function checking a binary header against that defined by the enclosing metadata specification.
This class cannot be inherited.
If the passed byte[] is not a header of the proper format, the function should return `null`.
TODO: Add discussion of required signature according to exceptions in method Register(...)

member.name: P:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.HeaderParserAttribute.HeaderLength
member.summary: The number of bytes this function processes to verify that the proper format header is present.
member.exception: New value for `set` is less than one.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified .
member.param: The number of bytes this function processes to verify that the proper format header is present.
member.exception: Value of is less than one.

member.name: T:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.TagFieldAttribute
member.summary: Marks a class as describing a field within a tag in a particular metadata format.
member.remarks: An exception will be thrown on registration if the class does not implement .

member.name: F:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.TagFieldAttribute.ISO88591
member.summary: Reference to the ISO-8859-1 character encoding to allow passing byte headers as compile-time constant `string`s.

member.name: P:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.TagFieldAttribute.Format
member.summary: The short name associated with the metadata format, or `null` if it should be obtained from the enclosing type.
member.remarks: If this is `null` (the default), the immediately-enclosing type must have a attribute, or an exception will be thrown on the call to .

member.name: P:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.TagFieldAttribute.Header
member.summary: A sequence of bytes used to uniquely identify this type of field.
member.remarks: If multiple fields have the same structure and differ only in this identifier, the may be added to a common class once for each such tag.

member.name: M:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.TagFieldAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with headers as given by any members decorated with a .

member.name: M:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.TagFieldAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified .
member.remarks: is passed as a `string` rather than a `byte[]` as it needs to be assigned via a compile-time constant.
member.param: The unique byte header indicating this type of field, represented as an ISO-8859-1 string.

member.name: T:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.FieldNamesAttribute
member.summary: Marks a method as returning a list of the headers to which the enclosing class applies, or a parameter/property as being such a predefined list.
member.remarks:
The field will not be registered under the returned under the returned headers unless the class has a without any string parameter.
If on a method: an exception will be thrown on class registration if it cannot be called without parameters or if it doesn't return an ; if on a parameter or property, it simply needs to be of that type. In both cases, the member must be `static` and `public`.

member.summary: The class encapsulating each registered metadata format.

member.summary: Get all field types registered for the given metadata format.
member.param: The short name of the desired format.

member.name: F:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.MetadataFormat.assemblies
member.summary: A registry of previously-scanned assemblies in order to prevent unnecessary use of reflection methods.

member.name: M:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.MetadataFormat.#cctor
member.summary: Automatically add any metadata classes in opened assemblies on first call to the class.

member.name: M:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.MetadataFormat.RefreshFormats``1
member.summary: Scan the assembly enclosing the specified for implementations of metadata formats.
member.remarks: The explicit type parameter is preferred over scanning loaded assemblies as oftentimes this will be the first time the
member.typeparam: Any type from the assembly to scan.

member.name: M:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.MetadataFormat.Register(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary:
Scan the given assembly for all types marked as implementing a metadata format in a suitable manner for automatic lookup.
Subsequent calls on a previously-scanned assembly will be ignored in order to save unnecessary type reflection.
member.param: The assembly to scan.

member.name: M:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.MetadataFormat.Register``1
member.summary: Add the given metadata format type to the lookup tables according to the descriptor specified in its .
member.remarks: Note that if multiple types are registered under the same name, any later registrations will override the previous.

member.name: M:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.MetadataFormat.Register``1(System.String)
member.summary: Add the given metadata format type to the lookup tables under the specified custom descriptor, even if it does not have any associated .
member.remarks:
The validation function must still be identified with a .
Note that if multiple types are registered under the same name, any later registrations will override the previous.
member.param:
A short name for the format to be used as an access key for later lookups.
It is recommended that this also be exposed as a constant.

member.name: M:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.MetadataFormat.Register``1(System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Add the given tag field type to the lookup tables under the proper format specifier.
member.param: The short name of the format defining this field, or `null` to autodetect from the enclosing class.
The unique specifier of this field.

member.name: M:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.MetadataFormat.Register``1(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Byte[]})
member.summary: Add the given tag field type to the lookup tables under the proper format specifier.
member.param: The short name of the format defining this field, or `null` to autodetect from the enclosing class.
The unique specifiers of this field.

member.summary: Group the restriction checking of validation functions for easy reuse.
member.param: The validation function to check.

member.name: M:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.MetadataFormat.Register(System.String,System.UInt32,System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Add the given format initialization method to the lookup tables under the specified custom descriptor.
member.remarks: This should almost purely be called via , and has been separated primarily for code clarity.
member.param: A short name for the format to be used as an access key for later lookups.
The number of bytes uses to read the tag header.
The method to add.

member.name: M:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.MetadataFormat.Register(System.String,System.Byte[],System.UInt32,System.Reflection.MethodInfo)

Note that if multiple methods are registered under the same and pairing, any later registrations will override the previous.

member.name: M:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.ReflectionData`1.ParseAsync(System.IO.Stream,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{AgEitilt.CardCatalog.ReflectionData{`0}})
member.summary: Check the stream against all registered formats, and return the sequence the occur in within the file.
member.remarks:
It is expected that no more than a single validation function will match any given sequence of bytes. If this is not the case, only the first-matched will be generated.
TODO: It may be best to return an object explicitly combining all recognized tags along with unknown data.
member.param: The bytestream to parse.
The types that might be contained in the stream.

member.name: T:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.TagField
member.summary: A single point of data saved in the tag, with default helper implementations.

member.name: P:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.TagField.SystemName
member.summary: The byte header used to internally identify the field.

member.name: P:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.TagField.Length
member.summary: The length in bytes of the data contained in the field (excluding the header).

member.name: P:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.TagField.Name
member.summary: The human-readable name of the field if available, or a representation of if not.
member.remarks: The default implementation is to read the as a UTF-8 encoded string enclosed in "{ " and " }"; if this is not suitable, the method should be overridden.

member.name: P:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.TagField.Subtitle
member.summary: Extra human-readable information describing the field, such as the "category" of a header with multiple realizations.
member.remarks: The default implementation is to return `null`; if this is not suitable, the method should be overridden.

member.name: P:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.TagField.Values
member.summary: All data contained by this field, in a human-readable format.
member.remarks:
A null value should be treated the same as an empty enumerable.
These will typically be array or instances, but some fields may return other types, such as . Using C#'s as or is keywords is intended for handling.
Images will be returned as an wrapper around the raw data; the render and display should be handled by the including program depending on platform requirements and capabilities.

member.name: M:AgEitilt.CardCatalog.TagField.Parse(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Read a sequence of bytes in the manner appropriate to the specific type of field.
member.param: The data to read.
